page.title: 08 FARMING
page.content: About half of this area is farmland. About half of the farmland is pasture and the rest is put to cereal crops. Wheat is grown for milling into flour,barley and oats are mainly grown for animal feed.They also harvest hay to feed cows and sheep in winter. Farmers also cut grass and make silage for winter feed. There is one dairy herd in this area that produces milk.Sheep are kept on the dryer fields.There is also a small amount of moorland grazing on the edge of Lee Moor to the north east. There is an agricultural merchants in the area that supplys fertiliser, seed and machinery parts.There is also a small nursery that sells plants and bushes. In the recent past,many of the hedges have been grubbed out in order to create larger fields.
